title: Diffuse Pulmonary Lymphangiomatosis: Demographics and Epidemiology
short_description: Clinical overview of diffuse pulmonary lymphangiomatosis demographics, including age distribution, gender prevalence, and diagnostic challenges.
long_description: This document provides epidemiological information about diffuse pulmonary lymphangiomatosis, a rare disorder that affects males and females equally across all racial and ethnic groups. While most reported cases occur in infants and children, the condition can also manifest in adults. The document highlights significant diagnostic challenges, noting that the disorder is frequently misdiagnosed or undiagnosed, which complicates efforts to determine its true incidence and prevalence in the general population. This information is crucial for healthcare providers to understand the scope and recognition challenges associated with this rare pulmonary condition.
